ai.summary: Greenleighton Moor Walk is an 11.5 km moderate hike across open moorland in the UK. The route offers rolling terrain and rewarding views on clear days, with a manageable elevation gain suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect grassy footpaths across open moorland, tussocky grasses, and occasional boggy patches. The path can be uneven and exposed in places, with rocky or compacted sections. Navigation can be challenging on featureless moor, so carry a map and compass or a GPS device.
ai.safety_notes: Weather on UK moors can change quickly. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Stay on marked paths, inform someone of your plan and expected return, and carry a map and compass (or GPS). Bring sufficient water and snacks. Be cautious of boggy areas and livestock if present. Mobile signal may be limited in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for milder, drier conditions; the route can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear.
